## Illinois Assisted Reproductive Healthcare Advisory Question (2024)

“Should all medically appropriate assisted reproductive treatments, including, but not limited to, in vitro fertilization, be covered by any health insurance plan in Illinois that provides coverage for pregnancy benefits, without limitation on the number of treatments?[2]”
“Should the Illinois Constitution be amended to create an additional 3% tax on income greater than $1,000,000 for the purpose of dedicating funds raised to property tax relief?[2]”
## Illinois Penalties for Candidate Interference with Election Worker's Duties Advisory Question (2024)

“Should any candidate appearing on the Illinois ballot for federal, State, or local office be subject to civil penalties if the candidate interferes or attempts to interfere with an election worker's official duties?[2]”

column1: ## North Shore Water Reclamation District Ward 1
## North Shore Water Reclamation District Ward 4
## North Shore Water Reclamation District Ward 5
## Illinois Assisted Reproductive Healthcare Advisory Question (2024)

“Should all medically appropriate assisted reproductive treatments, including, but not limited to, in vitro fertilization, be covered by any health insurance plan in Illinois that provides coverage for pregnancy benefits, without limitation on the number of treatments?[2]”
“Should the Illinois Constitution be amended to create an additional 3% tax on income greater than $1,000,000 for the purpose of dedicating funds raised to property tax relief?[2]”
## Illinois Penalties for Candidate Interference with Election Worker's Duties Advisory Question (2024)

“Should any candidate appearing on the Illinois ballot for federal, State, or local office be subject to civil penalties if the candidate interferes or attempts to interfere with an election worker's official duties?[2]”

,11.245327826596368,24.20500549209139,0.9175547163842701,0.5841455940212341,['Illinois Assisted Reproductive Healthcare Advisory Question (2024)', 'Illinois Income Tax Advisory Question (2024)', ""Illinois Penalties for Candidate Interference with Election Worker's Duties Advisory Question (2024)""]","['“Should all medically appropriate assisted reproductive treatments, including, but not limited to, in vitro fertilization, be covered by any health insurance plan in Illinois that provides coverage for pregnancy benefits, without limitation on the number of treatments?[2]”', '“Should the Illinois Constitution be amended to create an additional 3% tax on income greater than $1,000,000 for the purpose of dedicating funds raised to property tax relief?[2]”', ""“Should any candidate appearing on the Illinois ballot for federal, State, or local office be subject to civil penalties if the candidate interferes or attempts to interfere with an election worker's official duties?[2]”""]","# Ballot for McHenry County, Illinois
## Illinois Assisted Reproductive Healthcare Advisory Question (2024)

“Should all medically appropriate assisted reproductive treatments, including, but not limited to, in vitro fertilization, be covered by any health insurance plan in Illinois that provides coverage for pregnancy benefits, without limitation on the number of treatments?[2]”
“Should the Illinois Constitution be amended to create an additional 3% tax on income greater than $1,000,000 for the purpose of dedicating funds raised to property tax relief?[2]”
## Illinois Penalties for Candidate Interference with Election Worker's Duties Advisory Question (2024)

“Should any candidate appearing on the Illinois ballot for federal, State, or local office be subject to civil penalties if the candidate interferes or attempts to interfere with an election worker's official duties?[2]”

column4: Illinois 22nd Circuit Court, Illinois 2nd District Appellate Court

column1: ## Illinois Assisted Reproductive Healthcare Advisory Question (2024)

“Should all medically appropriate assisted reproductive treatments, including, but not limited to, in vitro fertilization, be covered by any health insurance plan in Illinois that provides coverage for pregnancy benefits, without limitation on the number of treatments?[2]”
“Should the Illinois Constitution be amended to create an additional 3% tax on income greater than $1,000,000 for the purpose of dedicating funds raised to property tax relief?[2]”
## Illinois Penalties for Candidate Interference with Election Worker's Duties Advisory Question (2024)

“Should any candidate appearing on the Illinois ballot for federal, State, or local office be subject to civil penalties if the candidate interferes or attempts to interfere with an election worker's official duties?[2]”
